original_solution_mapping.L1: The first night he read 20% of his 500-page book so he read .20*500 = <<20*.01*500=100>>100 pages
original_solution_mapping.L2: The book is 500 pages and he read 100 so that leaves 500-100 = <<500-100=400>>400 pages
original_solution_mapping.L3: The second night he reads 20% of the 500 pages so he read .20*500 = <<20*.01*500=100>>100 pages
original_solution_mapping.L4: The book is now 400 pages and he read 100 so that leaves 400-100 = <<400-100=300>>300 pages
original_solution_mapping.L5: The third night he read 30% of the book so he read .30*500 = <<30*.01*500=150>>150 pages
original_solution_mapping.L6: The book is now 300 pages and he read 150 pages so he has 300-150 =<<300-150=150>>150 pages left to read

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5966.
    Returns: the number of pages Xander has left to read.
    """
    # L1
    total_pages = 500 # 500-page book
    first_night_percent_num = 20 # 20%
    first_night_percent_decimal = 0.20 # 20% of his 500-page book in one hour
    percent_factor = 0.01 # WK
    pages_read_first_night = first_night_percent_decimal * total_pages

    # L2
    pages_left_after_first_night = total_pages - pages_read_first_night

    # L3
    second_night_percent_num = 20 # another 20%
    second_night_percent_decimal = 0.20 # another 20% of the book
    pages_read_second_night = second_night_percent_decimal * total_pages

    # L4
    pages_left_after_second_night = pages_left_after_first_night - pages_read_second_night

    # L5
    third_night_percent_num = 30 # 30%
    third_night_percent_decimal = 0.30 # 30% of his book
    pages_read_third_night = third_night_percent_decimal * total_pages

    # L6
    pages_left_final = pages_left_after_second_night - pages_read_third_night

    # FA
    answer = pages_left_final
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The first night he read {first_night_percent_num}% of his {total_pages}-page book so he read {first_night_percent_decimal}*{total_pages} = <<{first_night_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{total_pages}={pages_read_first_night}>>{pages_read_first_night} pages

The book is {total_pages} pages and he read {pages_read_first_night} so that leaves {total_pages}-{pages_read_first_night} = <<{total_pages}-{pages_read_first_night}={pages_left_after_first_night}>>{pages_left_after_first_night} pages

The second night he reads {second_night_percent_num}% of the {total_pages} pages so he read {second_night_percent_decimal}*{total_pages} = <<{second_night_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{total_pages}={pages_read_second_night}>>{pages_read_second_night} pages

The book is now {pages_left_after_first_night} pages and he read {pages_read_second_night} so that leaves {pages_left_after_first_night}-{pages_read_second_night} = <<{pages_left_after_first_night}-{pages_read_second_night}={pages_left_after_second_night}>>{pages_left_after_second_night} pages

The third night he read {third_night_percent_num}% of the book so he read {third_night_percent_decimal}*{total_pages} = <<{third_night_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{total_pages}={pages_read_third_night}>>{pages_read_third_night} pages

The book is now {pages_left_after_second_night} pages and he read {pages_read_third_night} pages so he has {pages_left_after_second_night}-{pages_read_third_night} =<<{pages_left_after_second_night}-{pages_read_third_night}={pages_left_final}>>{pages_left_final} pages left to read
